remarks: A function with a Cartesian product as domain is a mapping with two arguments defined by its operation values.  (Contributed by AV, 20-Feb-2019.)
statement:
fnmpt2ovd.m $e |- ( ph -> M Fn ( A X. B ) ) $.
fnmpt2ovd.s $e |- ( ( i = a /\ j = b ) -> D = C ) $.
fnmpt2ovd.d $e |- ( ( ph /\ i e. A /\ j e. B ) -> D e. U ) $.
fnmpt2ovd.c $e |- ( ( ph /\ a e. A /\ b e. B ) -> C e. V ) $.
fnmpt2ovd.v $e |- ( ph -> ( A e. X /\ B e. Y ) ) $.
fnmpt2ovd $p |- ( ph -> ( M = ( a e. A , b e. B |-> C ) <-> A. i e. A A. j e. B ( i M j ) = D ) ) $.
$d A a b i j $.
$d B a b i j $.
$d C i j $.
$d D a b $.
$d M a b i j $.
$d U a b i j $.
$d V a b i j $.
$d X a b i j $.
$d Y a b i j $.
$d a b i j ph $.
